blog.name: theladyoftheblog
blog.title: one day the sadness will end

tags: the bottom text is from simone weil's the iliad or the poem of force
of course i think sansa also cried simply because joffrey's death was terrible
but also because she was releasing a lot of anguish
summary: “Joffrey is dead”, she told the trees, to see if that would wake her.  He had not been dead when she left the throne room. He...
body:
“Joffrey is dead”, she told the trees, to see if that would wake her.

He had not been dead when she left the throne room. He had been on his knees, though, clawing at his throat, tearing at his own skin as he fought to breathe. The sight of it had been too terrible to watch, and she had turned and fled, sobbing. Lady Tanda had been fleeing as well. “You have a good heart, my lady,” she said to Sansa. “Not every maid would weep for a man who set her aside and wed her to a dwarf.”

A good heart. I have a good heart. Hysterical laughter rose up her gullet, but Sansa choked it back down. (…) Why was she crying, when she wanted to dance? Were they tears of joy?

reblog.comment:

A good heart. I have a good heart. Hysterical laughter rose up her gullet, but Sansa choked it back down. (…) Why was she crying, when she wanted to dance? Were they tears of joy?

trail.content_raw:

He had not been dead when she left the throne room. He had been on his knees, though, clawing at his throat, tearing at his own skin as he fought to breathe. The sight of it had been too terrible to watch, and she had turned and fled, sobbing. Lady Tanda had been fleeing as well. “You have a good heart, my lady,” she said to Sansa. “Not every maid would weep for a man who set her aside and wed her to a dwarf.”

A good heart. I have a good heart. Hysterical laughter rose up her gullet, but Sansa choked it back down. (…) Why was she crying, when she wanted to dance? Were they tears of joy?
trail.content:
“Joffrey is dead”, she told the trees, to see if that would wake her.

He had not been dead when she left the throne room. He had been on his knees, though, clawing at his throat, tearing at his own skin as he fought to breathe. The sight of it had been too terrible to watch, and she had turned and fled, sobbing. Lady Tanda had been fleeing as well. “You have a good heart, my lady,” she said to Sansa. “Not every maid would weep for a man who set her aside and wed her to a dwarf.”

A good heart. I have a good heart. Hysterical laughter rose up her gullet, but Sansa choked it back down. (…) Why was she crying, when she wanted to dance? Were they tears of joy?

blog.name: yournamewilldisappear
blog.title: All Memory of You Will Disappear
blog.description:
GoT sideblog for wesawbears. Named because I love Sansa Stark and will never stop being bitter about it.

Icon by violetchachkii.

summary: The war is over and Sansa is standing at the edge of a castle that isn't hers and thinking about how she doesn't know how to go...
body:
The war is over and Sansa is standing at the edge of a castle that isn’t hers and thinking about how she doesn’t know how to go home.

Winterfell is hers now. It’s hers and yet she still feels lost and as though one foot will make her lose her grip. She’s been here, unable to move one inch out of line for what feels like her whole life.

“Oh-my lady. Forgive me. Is everything alright?”

She looks up and sees, of all people, Theon, looking at her much the way he did at Winterfell, before they jumped.

It feels like that.

“I’m…well.”

He nods. “I’m glad to see it.”

“I heard you fought bravely in taking back King’s Landing.”

He pauses and shakes his head. “I did what anyone would have done.”

“But it wasn’t anyone. It was you.”

“My lady?”

She doesn’t know what it is that’s compelling her to act this way. But then again, perhaps this unmoored feeling is what it’s like to be in control again. To feel. She hasn’t felt that way in a long time.

So she takes a leap of faith.

“Walk with me?”

He takes her arm.

She doesn’t know what it is that’s compelling her to act this way. But then again, perhaps this unmoored feeling is what it’s like to be in control again. To feel. She hasn’t felt that way in a long time.

She looks up and sees, of all people, Theon, looking at her much the way he did at Winterfell, before they jumped.

It feels like that.

“I’m…well.”

He nods. “I’m glad to see it.”

“I heard you fought bravely in taking back King’s Landing.”

He pauses and shakes his head. “I did what anyone would have done.”

Our goal is to provide inspiration and quality sansan art, fanfiction recommendations , edits, meta, discussion, confessions, head canons and prompts for you.♡ We tag NSFW content. summary: I told you thousand times that Sansa will die with Stark hand like her Direwalf  look at what Maisie said  and she mentioned...
caption:
I told you thousand times that Sansa will die with Stark hand like her Direwalf 

look at what Maisie said  and she mentioned Sansa and Arya scene . where Arya  spoke with Sansa about her death . Arya said to Sansa that she can take her face and become Lady of Winterfell

‘’Arya was always killing the baddies,’’ Williams notes. “But then we saw her start to use those manipulative powers. It’s not until she had that whole dialogue with her sister Sansa in the last season that you realise what she’s become, that she’s being awful to someone who we love. For me, it was a really great moment as an actor to be able to play the character you love as a baddie.”

blog.description: We strive to make this a quality Sansan blog free of hate for book and show fans alike. Our goal is to provide inspiration and quality sansan art, fanfiction recommendations , edits, meta, discussion, confessions, head canons and prompts for you.♡ We tag NSFW content. title: Duda
body: Hola familia Jonsa, llegue a una duda que no se me había ocurrido preguntar con tiempo sobre el clip de HBO en el abrazo de Jon y Sansa, como es ya la ultima temporada creí que Sophie ya no llevaría la peluca y teñiría su pelo nuevamente de rojo, hahahaha realmente soy super ciega y no logro ver la diferencia, espero y deseo que si sea su cabello,la peluca a pesar de tener una apariencia natural no me encanto, pero ya si es el caso tendré que aceptarlo tampoco es que lo odie, ¿podrían ayudarme? gracias y que tengan lindo día. :D

blog.description: Welcome to the messy mind of an author, English teacher and maybe an adult. I post writing stuff sometimes. Mostly I reblog memes

summary: Sansa: Jon, how do I get revenge on my enemies? Jon: The best revenge is letting go and living well Sansa:... Sansa: Arya, how...
body:
Sansa: Jon, how do I get revenge on my enemies?

Jon: The best revenge is letting go and living well

Sansa:…

Sansa: Arya, how do I get–

Arya: I’m already packed. Let’s go.


Inspired by this post: http://readasaur.tumblr.com/post/178360870296/katara-aang-how-do-i-get-revenge-on-those-who

summary: I have fun reading the political meta in your site & other j/s writers. I read a write up once sepculating the role of magic in...
question: I have fun reading the political meta in your site & other j/s writers. I read a write up once sepculating the role of magic in the starks (forgot the source, sorry, I tried to find it again but w/o success). Anyway do you think Sansa’s songs and her appearance have significance magic-wise, in the general story? Thanks! 😊
answer:
Dear nonny,

I just give you a quick answer and refer you to my post on Sansa and music and songs (x), and music and songs in all the Starks’ storylines (x), both part of my fourpart meta on ‘singers singing songs and their impact on characters’.

I would also alert you to an ask I got about Florian and Jonquil and all the amazing additions to that post by the Jonsa fam (x).

To just give you the gist of it. Songs and music is part of the old magic of the children of the forest and all the Stark children have connections to the old magic. Warging and greenseeing is much more prominent, but if you look closely, you see that Sansa got the ‘music’ magic. I think that Sansa’s singing will have a huge impact on the story. It is my personal headcanon that her singing about ‘Florian and Jonquil’ will remind resurrected Jon of being human in the books. I even wrote a series of drabbles on that headcanon (here, here and here), my ‘Girl in Grey’ series.

Thanks for the ask and all the compliments!

Warging and greenseeing is much more prominent, but if you look closely, you see that Sansa got the ‘music’ magic. I think that Sansa’s singing will have a huge impact on the story. I would also alert you to an ask I got about Florian and Jonquil and all the amazing additions to that post by the Jonsa fam (x).

To just give you the gist of it. Songs and music is part of the old magic of the children of the forest and all the Stark children have connections to the old magic. Warging and greenseeing is much more prominent, but if you look closely, you see that Sansa got the ‘music’ magic. I think that Sansa’s singing will have a huge impact on the story. It is my personal headcanon that her singing about ‘Florian and Jonquil’ will remind resurrected Jon of being human in the books. I even wrote a series of drabbles on that headcanon (here, here and here), my ‘Girl in Grey’ series.

Thanks for the ask and all the compliments!
trail.content:
Dear nonny,

I just give you a quick answer and refer you to my post on Sansa and music and songs (x), and music and songs in all the Starks’ storylines (x), both part of my fourpart meta on ‘singers singing songs and their impact on characters’.

I would also alert you to an ask I got about Florian and Jonquil and all the amazing additions to that post by the Jonsa fam (x).

To just give you the gist of it. Songs and music is part of the old magic of the children of the forest and all the Stark children have connections to the old magic. Warging and greenseeing is much more prominent, but if you look closely, you see that Sansa got the ‘music’ magic. I think that Sansa’s singing will have a huge impact on the story. It is my personal headcanon that her singing about ‘Florian and Jonquil’ will remind resurrected Jon of being human in the books. I even wrote a series of drabbles on that headcanon (here, here and here), my ‘Girl in Grey’ series.

Thanks for the ask and all the compliments!
